name: Old Las Palmas
description: Old Las Palmas is one of Palm Springs' most storied and sought-after neighborhoods, celebrated for its historic charm and luxurious lifestyle. Established in the 1920s, it became a haven for Hollywood’s elite, including Cary Grant and Elizabeth Taylor, drawn by its privacy, beauty, and proximity to the San Jacinto Mountains. The neighborhood is home to a few hundred properties, showcasing a blend of Spanish Colonial Revival and Mid-Century Modern architecture. These residences, set on expansive lots with gated entries and lush landscaping, offer a harmonious blend of old-world elegance and modern luxury. Streets lined with towering palm trees and vibrant citrus groves enhance the community's oasis-like ambiance. Nestled near downtown Palm Springs, Old Las Palmas provides convenient access to world-class dining and shopping while maintaining an air of exclusivity. Its rich history, stunning mountain views, and enduring appeal make it a highly desirable address and a sound investment in the Coachella Valley's real estate market.

name: The Movie Colony
description: The Movie Colony is one of Palm Springs’ most celebrated and historically significant neighborhoods, known for its storied past and classic elegance. Originally developed in the 1930s, this area quickly became a retreat for Hollywood’s brightest stars, who sought refuge from the city’s hustle under the desert sun. Legends such as Frank Sinatra, Cary Grant, and Marilyn Monroe once called this neighborhood home, solidifying its reputation as a glamorous haven for the elite. Nestled just east of downtown Palm Springs, The Movie Colony boasts a prime location that offers the perfect balance of tranquility and accessibility. Residents enjoy peaceful, palm-lined streets set against the dramatic backdrop of the San Jacinto Mountains, while being just moments away from the vibrant dining, shopping, and cultural scene of the city center. This historic enclave is home to a few hundred properties, each showcasing a distinctive charm. Architectural styles range from Spanish Colonial Revival to Mid-Century Modern, with homes featuring signature design elements such as stucco exteriors, red tile roofs, expansive glass walls, and lushly landscaped courtyards. Many properties also include resort-style amenities like pools, guest casitas, and outdoor living spaces, perfect for embracing the indoor-outdoor lifestyle synonymous with Palm Springs. The Movie Colony’s rich history and architectural beauty have made it a sought-after neighborhood for those seeking a blend of old Hollywood glamour and modern luxury. It is also highly regarded for its walkability and proximity to iconic Palm Springs landmarks, such as the Uptown Design District and Ruth Hardy Park. Whether drawn by its historical significance, stunning natural surroundings, or enduring charm, The Movie Colony continues to be a premier address in the Coachella Valley.

name: Vista Las Palmas
description: Vista Las Palmas is one of the most iconic neighborhoods in Palm Springs, celebrated for its Mid-Century Modern architecture and rich connection to Hollywood's Golden Age. Developed primarily in the late 1950s and early 1960s, the neighborhood quickly gained fame as a glamorous desert retreat for celebrities and socialites. Stars like Dean Martin, Peter Lawford, and Debbie Reynolds once graced this area with their presence, earning it the nickname “The Rat Pack Playground.” Nestled against the base of the San Jacinto Mountains, Vista Las Palmas offers breathtaking mountain views that frame its meticulously designed homes. The dramatic desert landscape provides a stunning contrast to the clean, modern lines of the architecture, creating a visual harmony that has made this neighborhood world-famous. Many homes were designed by the legendary architect William Krisel and built by the Alexander Construction Company, whose work defined the Mid-Century Modern aesthetic in Palm Springs. The homes in Vista Las Palmas are celebrated for their timeless elegance and innovative design. Signature features include post-and-beam construction, expansive walls of glass, butterfly roofs, and seamless indoor-outdoor living spaces. Many properties also feature private pools, lush landscaping, and spacious patios, perfect for entertaining and enjoying the desert’s year-round sunshine. These elements make the neighborhood a living showcase of architectural innovation and effortless luxury. Located just northwest of downtown Palm Springs, Vista Las Palmas combines a serene residential atmosphere with easy access to the city’s vibrant cultural and social scene. Its proximity to dining, shopping, and entertainment ensures that residents enjoy both privacy and convenience. The neighborhood’s architectural significance and enduring charm have also made it a magnet for design enthusiasts and those seeking to own a piece of Palm Springs’ storied history. Today, Vista Las Palmas continues to captivate homeowners and visitors alike with its unique blend of history, architecture, and natural beauty. Whether drawn by the allure of its celebrity past, the iconic Mid-Century Modern homes, or the stunning mountain backdrop, Vista Las Palmas remains one of the most sought-after neighborhoods in Palm Springs.

name: Deepwell Estates
description: Deepwell Estates is a cherished neighborhood in Palm Springs, celebrated for its rich history, architectural beauty, and serene residential charm. Developed in the late 1940s and 1950s, this community began as a private estate owned by Henry Pearson, who dug an exceptionally deep well on the property, giving the area its name. Over time, the estate was subdivided, and Deepwell Estates became one of the most sought-after neighborhoods in the city. Nestled in South Palm Springs, Deepwell Estates is renowned for its tranquil streets lined with mature palm trees and impeccably landscaped properties. The neighborhood is home to more than a few hundred homes, many of which were designed in the Mid-Century Modern style by acclaimed architects. These residences feature signature elements such as clean lines, expansive glass windows, and open floor plans that invite the desert light into every room. Alongside Mid-Century Modern gems, there are also Spanish Revival and Ranch-style homes, offering a mix of architectural styles that contribute to the neighborhood’s unique character. Deepwell Estates has a storied past as a favorite destination for Hollywood’s elite during the mid-20th century. Luminaries such as Jerry Lewis, William Holden, and Elizabeth Taylor once resided here, drawn by the neighborhood’s exclusivity and picturesque surroundings. The area’s proximity to the San Jacinto Mountains provides stunning views and a sense of seclusion, while its location near downtown Palm Springs ensures easy access to world-class dining, shopping, and cultural attractions. The neighborhood’s enduring appeal lies in its seamless blend of history, style, and convenience. Deepwell Estates offers residents a quiet, upscale lifestyle with all the amenities of Palm Springs just moments away. Whether for its iconic Mid-Century Modern homes, rich Hollywood history, or stunning natural backdrop, Deepwell Estates remains one of the most desirable neighborhoods in the Coachella Valley.

name: Indian Canyons
description: Indian Canyons is a premier neighborhood in South Palm Springs, renowned for its luxurious homes, golf-centric lifestyle, and breathtaking natural surroundings. Nestled against the San Jacinto Mountains, the neighborhood takes its name from the nearby Indian Canyons, a series of picturesque desert oases that hold deep cultural and historical significance for the Agua Caliente Band of Cahuilla Indians. Developed primarily in the 1960s and 1970s, Indian Canyons showcases a stunning collection of Mid-Century Modern and contemporary homes. Many of these residences were designed by renowned architects and feature hallmark design elements such as clean lines, open floor plans, and large windows that frame the dramatic mountain vistas. Homes often include spacious outdoor living areas, private pools, and meticulously landscaped yards, perfect for embracing Palm Springs’ indoor-outdoor lifestyle. The neighborhood is also home to some striking examples of Spanish Revival and Ranch-style architecture, adding to its diverse aesthetic appeal. At the heart of Indian Canyons lies the iconic Indian Canyons Golf Resort, featuring two 18-hole championship golf courses surrounded by lush fairways and towering palm trees. This world-class golfing destination has drawn players and enthusiasts for decades and provides a vibrant social hub for the community. Beyond the golf courses, residents enjoy proximity to some of Palm Springs’ best hiking trails, including those in the nearby Tahquitz and Andreas Canyons, where scenic desert landscapes and tranquil streams await exploration. Indian Canyons offers a peaceful, upscale atmosphere while being just minutes away from downtown Palm Springs. Its location provides easy access to fine dining, boutique shopping, and cultural attractions, making it a perfect blend of natural beauty and urban convenience. Whether for its architectural significance, stunning mountain backdrop, or vibrant golfing culture, Indian Canyons remains a highly sought-after address in the Coachella Valley.

name: Twin Palms
description: Twin Palms is a historic neighborhood in Palm Springs that stands as a cornerstone of Mid-Century Modern architecture. Developed in the late 1940s and early 1950s, Twin Palms was the first large-scale residential project by the Alexander Construction Company, a name synonymous with the modernist movement in the Coachella Valley. This neighborhood marked the beginning of Palm Springs’ transformation into a hub for cutting-edge architectural design and stylish desert living. Located in South Palm Springs, Twin Palms features more than a few hundred homes, many of which were designed by famed architect William Krisel. These homes are celebrated for their iconic butterfly roofs, clerestory windows, and post-and-beam construction, which emphasize simplicity and functionality while seamlessly integrating with the surrounding desert landscape. The neighborhood’s name comes from the twin palm trees often planted in the front yards of these properties, a signature detail that has become a hallmark of the community. Twin Palms offers a tranquil, residential vibe while remaining conveniently close to downtown Palm Springs. Residents enjoy easy access to the city’s vibrant dining, shopping, and cultural scene, as well as nearby hiking trails in the surrounding mountains. The streets of Twin Palms are lined with mature palm trees and well-maintained homes, many of which have been lovingly restored to preserve their original character while incorporating modern upgrades. The neighborhood’s rich history and architectural significance have made it a favorite among Mid-Century Modern enthusiasts and those seeking a slice of Palm Springs’ storied past. With its iconic design, scenic mountain views, and proximity to local amenities, Twin Palms remains one of the most desirable neighborhoods for those who appreciate the timeless appeal of modernist desert living.

Situated near the iconic Araby Cove and nestled against the base of the San Jacinto Mountains, this neighborhood offers a blend of seclusion and convenience, making it a sought-after destination for homeowners seeking a serene retreat. Developed primarily in the mid-20th century, Araby Commons features a variety of home styles, including Mid-Century Modern, Ranch-style, and contemporary designs. Homes in this neighborhood often highlight the indoor-outdoor living that Palm Springs is famous for, with large windows and open floor plans that frame breathtaking views of the mountains and desert. The location of Araby Commons provides easy access to some of Palm Springs’ best hiking trails, including those in the nearby Araby Trail, which offers panoramic views of the valley. The neighborhood is also conveniently located near premier shopping and dining destinations, including Smoke Tree Village and the bustling downtown Palm Springs area. Residents enjoy the perfect balance of a peaceful residential environment and the amenities of city living. Araby Commons has a reputation for its friendly community atmosphere and understated elegance. Its unique combination of natural beauty, architectural variety, and close proximity to both outdoor recreation and urban conveniences makes it a treasured neighborhood in Palm Springs. Whether for its serene setting, striking views, or architectural charm, Araby Commons captures the essence of desert living and remains a favorite for those seeking a private yet connected lifestyle in the Coachella Valley.

name: Little Beverly Hills
description: Little Beverly Hills is a delightful and historic neighborhood in Palm Springs, known for its Mid-Century Modern charm, quiet streets, and welcoming community vibe. Situated in South Palm Springs near the Tahquitz Creek Golf Resort, this neighborhood offers a blend of classic desert architecture and a serene residential setting, making it a sought-after destination for homeowners and vacationers alike. Developed in the 1950s and 1960s, Little Beverly Hills features a collection of Mid-Century Modern homes, many of which were built by the iconic Alexander Construction Company. These homes are characterized by their clean lines, open floor plans, and distinctive rooflines, all designed to harmonize with the desert environment. Large windows and sliding glass doors create a seamless connection between indoor and outdoor spaces, allowing residents to enjoy the stunning mountain views and year-round sunshine. The neighborhood’s quiet streets are lined with mature palm trees and vibrant desert landscaping, creating a peaceful and picturesque environment. Homes are situated on spacious lots, many featuring private pools and outdoor entertaining areas that embrace the indoor-outdoor lifestyle for which Palm Springs is renowned. Little Beverly Hills enjoys a prime location just minutes from downtown Palm Springs, providing easy access to the city’s renowned dining, shopping, and cultural attractions. The neighborhood is also adjacent to the Tahquitz Creek Golf Resort, offering residents the opportunity to enjoy two championship golf courses and scenic walking trails. Known for its friendly and welcoming atmosphere, Little Beverly Hills attracts a mix of full-time residents, seasonal homeowners, and architecture enthusiasts. Its combination of iconic design, natural beauty, and convenient location makes it a beloved neighborhood in the Coachella Valley. Whether for its architectural significance, tranquil ambiance, or proximity to local amenities, Little Beverly Hills captures the essence of classic Palm Springs living and continues to be a cherished community in the desert.
